Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery bird bowl; interior glazed (fired brown in places) with three (possibly four) narrow bands in added white and red; top of rim glazed but worn; exterior: most of cross-hatched lozenge pendent from rim; at bottom of sherd, top of a probable ray; at right, tail, part of body, and of one leg of cross-hatched bird.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The piece is of Kirschner's group VI, of the later seventh or early sixth century.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.061)
